column4: in my synaptic manager : gnash, gnash-common, mozilla-plugin-nash
and adobe flashplugin
all above installed
use adobe-flashplugin as the other is crashy as all hell

go to "System > Administration > Software Sources" then go to 3rd party tab and enable/tick the partners repository.. once dont quit software sources and reload your package list.. then do "sudo apt-get install adobe-flashplugin"
also remove any other flash installs such as gnash
as I said already
also close your browser as it obviously is not going to work if you leave it open the whole time while installing
are you doing as I said?
well?
did you even do what I said
well?
it is as it is.. unless you want to reverse engineer flash to find out I suggest you drop it :)
and you removed gnash and flashplugin-nonfree
hmm
are you using 32 bit or 64 bit
really.. hmm.. are you using 8.10 64 bit or 32 bit?
which version of ubuntu and is it 64 or 32 bit?
ah "uname -r" in a terminal
